Job description

We are looking for an experienced full stack developer to join us in building our great platform for communication, leadership, payments, and individual development for sports in our Stockholm office.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.5.3″ text_font=”||||||||” text_text_color=”rgba(47,50,54,0.8)” text_font_size=”18px” text_line_height=”1.5em” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_font_size=”40px” header_2_line_height=”1.1em” header_3_text_color=”#2f3236″ header_3_font_size=”20px” header_3_line_height=”0.9em” custom_margin=”|||” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” text_line_height_tablet=”1.4em” text_line_height_phone=”” text_line_height_last_edited=”on|tablet” header_2_font_size_tablet=”30px” header_2_font_size_phone=”” header_2_font_size_last_edited=”on|desktop”]

What is 360Player?

360Player is an innovative growth company within sports technology. We have created a digital platform for development of sporting organizations, teams and players. Today we are a global team of 60+ people, with eleven working in central Stockholm.

How we work

We’re building a global product, making decisions as a team. As a developer your opinion is valued at 360Player, and your ability to express it is important. We work in two week sprints, checking in with the entire organization often, talking to our partners abroad to ensure we’re doing the right things in the right markets. Our product is available in several languages and locales, and on multiple platforms.

You will work across our entire stack, where our backend mostly consists of Go and SQL Server, the apps are JavaScript and TypeScript based. We encourage our developers to learn and understand our entire product, that applies to both code and business.

We value a healthy work/life balance, while we’re 100% engaged in the product, work should never interfere with your personal life.

Who are you?

You probably have 5+ years of experience working with backend development across several languages, and you are eager to learn and adopt new technologies. You also possess experience and knowledge in frontend development. Your ability to write efficient, secure and readable code is important.

We value our users’ privacy, and that begins in the backend services. You don’t want to take shortcuts when it comes to privacy and security, understanding that it will punish us in the future.

You will have responsibility over several backend services, ranging from database management tools to the core API service. We currently deploy all our backend services as Docker images on Azure, experience with both of these is a bonus.

Frontend wise you will bring features from concept to delivery, making independent decisions as you go, you’re driven by a desire to create well-functioning and easy to use interfaces. Close cooperation with our designers and the rest of the organization is expected, and your input during the design process is appreciated. 

An interest in sports is a plus, but definitely not a requirement.

Required skills

  • Experience working in Go
  • Good understanding of relational databases and SQL
  • TypeScript
  • React
  • Redis
  • Docker
  • Git
  • Redux and Immutable.js experience a bonus
  • Fluent communication in written and spoken English
  • Working with version control
  • Experience working in product development

Location

You will be working from our head office in central Stockholm, although during Covid we have implemented a work from home policy.

Employment Terms

The position is full time. 

How to apply

You are welcome to mail us your cv and personal letter to people@360player.com. Please also share your Github profile (optional).

Interviews are ongoing.

We look forward to your application!

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
